item.title: Prominent scientists sign declaration that animals have conscious awareness, just like us
item.description: Guess I need to go vegetarian D: - http://t.co/I5GekEnA
item.content:encoded: Guess I need to go vegetarian D: - http://t.co/I5GekEnA An international group of prominent scientists has signed The Cambridge Declaration on Consciousness in which they are proclaiming their support for the idea that animals are conscious and aware to the degree that humans are — a list of animals that includes all mammals, birds, and even the octopus. But will this make us stop treating these animals in totally inhumane ways? Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: io9.com

item.title: My New Rule for Todd Akin and the Republican Party
item.description: My New Rule for Todd Akin and the Republican Party http://t.co/IhMSKphs
item.content:encoded: My New Rule for Todd Akin and the Republican Party http://t.co/IhMSKphs Republicans would like to pretend like Congressman Akin's substitution of superstition for science is a lone problem but it's not: they're all magical thinkers, on nearly every issue. They don't get their answers on climate change from climatologists, they get them from the Book of Genesis. Hence Sharia Law in America is a dire threat, and global warming a hoax. How do they get away with it? They know that, because we're already such a religious country, our minds are primed for magical, fantasy thinking. The gullibility comes factory-installed. They've learned that you appeal not to an American's head, but to his gut -- it's a much bigger target. But here's the problem: life is complicated. Next week in Tampa the Republicans must admit that the difference between a GOP convention and Comic-Con is that the people at Comic-Con have a much firmer grasp of reality. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com

item.title: 10 People Shot Outside The Empire State Building
item.description: Last night in Chicago, 13 people were shot in 30 minutes http://t.co/fKEjMfwq
item.content:encoded: Last night in Chicago, 13 people were shot in 30 minutes http://t.co/fKEjMfwq A shooting occurred Friday morning outside the Empire State Building on 34th Street in New York City, according to police. Three people are reportedly dead, as is the gunman. Emergency personnel received a call about the shooting just after 9 am. The motive of the shooting is not yet clear. The shooting follows a killing spree last night in the south and west sides of Chicago, in which 19 people were shot in just 30 minutes, including seven men and one woman, 14 to 20 years old. Chicago homicides have skyrocketed in the past few months. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: thinkprogress.org
